discussion.content:
Currently, all services support logging by Audit. Object Storage service supports logging for bucket-related events, but not for object-related events. This rules out B.

Retention period is a tenancy-level setting. The value of the retention period setting affects all regions and all compartments. The retention period cannot be changed. D is correct

https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Audit/Tasks/settingretentionperiod.htm

Selected Answer: B
B looks correct answer to me.

Selected Answer: B
The statement "Changes within the objects stored in an Object Storage bucket are collected as Audit logs" is NOT correct regarding the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Audit service.

The OCI Audit service primarily captures and records changes related to OCI resources and activities, including actions performed within the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Console and REST API calls to manage and interact with OCI resources. It is focused on tracking activities related to Oracle Cloud resources and services, not changes within specific objects stored in Object Storage buckets.

So, option B is not a valid statement.

Right B,
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Audit/Tasks/settingretentionperiod.htm

questions.question_text:
As your company's cloud architect, you have been invited by the CEO to join his staff meeting. They want your input on interconnecting Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) to another cloud provider in London, with some specific requirements:
They want resources in the other cloud provider to leverage OCI Autonomous Data Warehouse ML capabilities.
The connection between OCI and the other cloud provider should be provisioned as quickly as possible.
The connection should offer high bandwidth and predictable performance.
Which other cloud provider should you recommend to interconnect with OCI and meet the above requirements?

You have an instance running in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) that cannot be live-migrated during an infrastructure maintenance event. OCI schedules a maintenance due date within 14 to 16 days and sends you a notification.
What would happen if you choose not to proactively reboot the instance before the scheduled maintenance due date?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://docs.oracle.com/iaas/Content/Compute/References/infrastructure-maintenance.htm#:~:text=If%20an%20instance%20cannot%20be,is%20reboot%20migrated%20for%20you.

Selected Answer: A
A looks correct, In live-migrate need to reduce the downtime.

Selected Answer: A
A. The instance is either reboot-migrated or rebuilt in place for you.

OCI will attempt to perform the maintenance on the instance. Depending on the nature of the maintenance and the specific resources impacted, OCI may either live-migrate the instance to a different physical host or, in some cases, rebuild the instance in place to apply the necessary updates. The goal is to minimize downtime and impact on your instance, and OCI will take the appropriate action to ensure that.

Selected Answer: A
If you choose to ignore this information, the instances go through the planned maintenance process, including a reboot.

https://blogs.oracle.com/cloud-infrastructure/post/customer-managed-vm-maintenance-with-reboot-migration

choices.A: The instance is either reboot-migrated or rebuilt in place for you.
choices.C: You will receive another notification to reboot within the next 7 days.
choices.D: You will receive another notification to reboot within the next 14 days.

comments.content: SOrry it is the C teh right answer because SSH run on the 22 port, the ingress rule on NSG and Security List must contain O.O.O.O/O on 22 port
B may be correct and best practice. But the question is "What could be the problem?". The answer should be how to resolve problem, not what is best practice in any case.

discussion.content: B is correct

choices.B: Internet traffic should be allowed only on the NSG.
choices.D: Public subnet does not have a route rule to the Internet Gateway.
choices.C: SSH traffic is not allowed in the security list nor on the NSG from the Internet.
choices.A: User will be able to SSH to the VM from the Internet as SSH is open on the NSG.
